intro: Varronia polycephala, commonly known as the African sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are small berries that contain several seeds. Varronia polycephala is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
